story.text: (Recasts, adds outlook) Jan 3 Medical device maker AngioDynamics Inc. (ANGO.O) reported quarterly results above Wall Street view backed by strong growth in all major product categories, and raised its fiscal 2007 outlook. The company reported second-quarter earnings of $2.5 million, or 15 cents a share, compared with net income of $1.7 million, or 13 cents a share, a year ago. Net sales rose to $24.4 million from $18.7 million. Analysts were expecting earnings of 13 cents a share on revenue of $24.0 million, according to Reuters Estimates. AngioDynamics raised its fiscal 2007 earnings outlook to 65 cents a share from 60 cents. Analysts on average expect earnings of 60 cents a share, including stock-based compensation, for the period. Without the effect of stock-based compensation, net income is expected to be about 76 cents a share, the company said in a statement. For fiscal 2007, it expects net sales growth to exceed 30 percent compared with fiscal 2006. (Reporting by Rajeshwari Sharma in Bangalore)
story.title: update 1 - angiodynamics q2 net beats estimates , raises fy07 view
